articles.description: India Business News: Punjab National Bank (PNB) has reported over three-fold jump in net profit to Rs 2,223 crore in the Dec quarter - the highest in the last 15 quarters - on the back of higher interest income and improved asset quality.

articles.title: Evergrande's possible liquidation and what happens next | Mint - Mint
articles.description: A key offshore bondholder group of China Evergrande plans to join a petition to liquidate the developer, increasing the chances of an immediate liquidation order from the court.
articles.content: A key offshore bondholder group of China Evergrande plans to join a petition to liquidate the developer at a hearing in a Hong Kong court on Monday, Reuters reported this week. The bondholder group o… [+3829 chars]

articles.author: ET Now Digital
articles.title: ACC Share Price Target 2024: Jefferies BULLISH on Adani Group's cement stock following strong Q3 results - check details - ET Now
articles.description: ACC's stock opened a gap at Rs 2,248.70 on the NSE and continued to trend northward to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 2,563.75 before settling at Rs 2,509, up 3.39 per cent from its previous close of Rs 2,240.60 on Thursday.
articles.content: The brokerage firm pointed out that the Indian cement make company has reported strong beat with EBITDA growing to Rs 905 crore Vs estimate of Rs 730 crore. (Image: Company's website/ET Now News)

articles.title: India's forex reserves decline by $2.79 billion to $616.14 billion | Mint - Mint
articles.description: As per the Weekly Statistical Supplement published by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), Foreign Currency Assets (FCAs) experienced a decline of $2.6 billion, settling at $545.8 billion.

articles.title: Lenders move NCLT Bengaluru to initiative insolvency proceedings against Byju's - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
articles.description: International lenders of Byju's have filed petitions in the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) at Bengaluru to initiate insolvency proceedings against the ed-
articles.content: International lenders of Byju's have filed petitions in the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) at Bengaluru to initiate insolvency proceedings against the ed-tech start-up.
